item.title: Most Economists Agree That Workers Pay 70% of Corporate Taxes
item.description:
Chris, most economists believe that over 70 percent of corporate taxes are paid for by the workers. And the fact that the Treasury Department, I think it was eight or 10 years ago, put out a piece otherwise. I don’t believe in that. Our current economic team does not believe in that. There is lots of economic research.

— Steve Mnuchin, interview with Chris Wallace on Fox News

Claims:

Most Economists Agree That Workers Pay 70% of Corporate Taxes
The Truth:
Economists are divided on this issue, and some do believe this, but not most.

Fact Checks:

FactCheck.org
We have learned here at FactCheck.org that it is rarely possible to definitively settle arguments between competing economists. But we can say Mnuchin stretches the facts when he says “most economists” share his view.

item.title: Donald Trump Has Provided More Financial Disclosure Than Anyone
item.description:
The President has no intention – the President has released plenty of information and I think has given more financial disclosure than anybody else. I think the American population has plenty of information on this.

— Steve Mnuchin, press briefing

Claims:

Donald Trump Has Provided More Financial Disclosure Than Anyone
The Truth:
Trump has not released his tax returns, which every major-party nominee for the past 4 decades has done.

Fact Checks:

PolitiFact
Trump released a financial disclosure report that all presidential candidates are required to fill out, but the fact that Trump has not released any tax filings undermines Munchin’s claim.
